SUMMARY: U.S. employers added 315,000 jobs in August, while the unemployment rate rose to 3.7% from 3.5% in July. A tight job market gives workers more bargaining power, but it may also fuel inflation.

SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Dr. Rochelle Walensky, director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, about the CDC's authorization of new omicron-specific booster shots.

TITLE: There's no bad time to get a new COVID booster if you're eligible, CDC director says
SUMMARY: People can get the Moderna booster if they're 18 or older, and the Pfizer-BioNTech version if they're 12 and up. In both cases, they must wait at least two months since their last COVID vaccine.

TITLE: As school starts, teachers add a mental-health check-in to their lesson plans
SUMMARY: After the disruption and trauma of the pandemic, educators say kids still need added support this year. In some schools, they're making emotional wellness part of the curriculum.

TITLE: White House asks for $47 billion for Ukraine, COVID-19, monkeypox and disasters
SUMMARY: The administration hopes the funding request will become part of an upcoming short-term spending bill aimed at funding the federal government beyond Sept. 30.

TITLE: Jehovah's Witnesses resume door-to-door visits for the first time since the pandemic
SUMMARY: "I've been looking forward to this day," said one member of the faith. "When I rang the first doorbell this morning, a total calm came over me. I was back where I needed to be."

SUMMARY: In the city of Nowshera, tent cities for flood refugees are springing up on college campuses. At one such haven, mothers spoke to NPR about their struggle to survive.

SUMMARY: The university presidents who oversee the College Football Playoff voted to expand the postseason model for determining a national champion from four teams no later than the 2026 season.

SUMMARY: According a civil action filed in Los Angeles Superior Court Tuesday, the entertainers allegedly sexually abused a brother and sister when they were age 7 and 14.

SUMMARY: "I've been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma and have started chemo treatments," the actress, activist, and former fitness guru  told her Instagram followers on Friday.

SUMMARY: FINA, the governing body for international swim competitions, had rejected the design of Soul Cap's head covering ahead of last year's Olympics.

TITLE: Serena Williams loses to Ajla Tomljanovic in U.S. Open farewell
SUMMARY: The 23-time Grand Slam champion staved off five match points to prolong the three-hours-plus proceedings, but could not do more, and was eliminated from the U.S. Open in the third round.

TITLE: A Northern California wildfire has injured several people and destroyed homes
SUMMARY: About 7,500 people in the town of Weed and several nearby communities in Northern California were under evacuation orders.

TITLE: The Monkees' drummer wants the FBI to quit monkeying around and hand over files
SUMMARY: The last surviving member of The Monkees, a rock band that formed in 1966, is suing the FBI. Micky Dolenz wants the government to hand over any files on him and his deceased bandmates.

TITLE: Stressed out about climate change? 4 ways to tackle both the feelings and the issues
SUMMARY: Heat waves, drought, massive storms. The bad news just keeps coming and there's no denying these issues are anxiety-provoking. If you feel that way, you're not alone.

TITLE: Goodnight Moon has comforted kids at bedtime for 75 years
SUMMARY: Since its publication on September 3, 1947, the book has lulled children around the world to sleep with its dreamy ritual of bidding "goodnight" to everything in the "great green room."

TITLE: Take two. NASA readies its second launch attempt for its Artemis 1 moon mission
SUMMARY: NASA is counting down the hours to its second attempt to launch its new moon rocket. The two-hour launch window for its Artemis 1 test mission opens at 2:17 p.m. Eastern on Saturday.

TITLE: A Paris shop gets in on the non-alcoholic wine trend. Will the French drink it?
SUMMARY: French producers are making zero-proof wines now, and a new store in the capital wants to get in on the action. But market analysts say the drink has been slower to catch on in France than in the U.S.

TITLE: Sri Lanka's ousted president returns home after fleeing
SUMMARY: Sri Lanka's former president, Gotabaya Rajapaksa, fled the country in July after tens of thousands of protesters stormed his home and office in a display of anger over the country's economic crisis.

TITLE: Whatever happened to the African-born pizza chef who won over biased Italians?
SUMMARY: Ibrahim Songne overcame local prejudice to gain success in Italy with his pizza joint and a spot on a list of top 50 global pizza joints. He's now made a special pizza in honor of ... Goats and Soda!
